attributes.title: Physical stock verification
attributes.description:
The table below shows the summary of the stock findings (23.05.2025)

·           The following were the stock findings;

ü  Yeast +125g.

ü  Vegetable oil - +0.852ltrs.

ü  Bread -     -49 loaves

ü  Cumulative variance in polybags was +246pieces

All other materials had negligible variances.
attributes.recommendation: ·           The management to ensure that the set stock controls are consistently adhered to avoid stock variances.
attributes.effect: + Minimal variances noted in stock items is an indication that stock controls are being observed.

value: ·           More improvement measures will be initiated.
·           Control is ok and will maintain the trend.
• Physical stock take on 25.04.2025 highlighted bread stock shortfall (134pcs on aggregate), surplus polybags stocks (cumulatively 787pcs).
Previous

• A stock take exercise was conducted on 23.05.25 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place to safeguard company assets such as the production materials and the finished products.
+ Strong internal controls were noted.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring strong internal controls.

attributes.title: Dough weight analysis.
attributes.description:
·          The below table shows analysis of dough weights sampled on 24/05/2025;

Dough weights sampled on 24.05.2025:(1 st shift @05.50pm)

ü  Dough weights showed high overweight rate.
attributes.recommendation:
·         Standard set dough dividing weights should be adhered to in order to ensure production of standard weight bread.

  • High dough and packed bread overweight rate should be addressed.
attributes.effect:
+ Inconsistent dough weights imply production of over and underweight bread compromising production of standard weight bread as per company policy.

+ Overweight bread deprives the company revenues.

value: • We will sensitize dough dividers adhere to set standard dough dividing weights and do frequent spot checks to ensure that set dough weights are observed.
• We will put more efforts and address overweight bread noted and also ensure production of standard weight bread.
• Dough weights sampled on 25.04.2025 showed high underweight  rate.
Previous
• Sample varieties of dough and packed bread were randomly picked and weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.
+ High overweight dough samples noted. This means non-compliance to set standard dough weights.
Operations/Production Department
+ Adhering to set standard dough dividing weights.

attributes.title: Packed bread weight analysis
attributes.description:
·         Bread weights were sampled on 23/05/2025 and the following below were the results.

High overweight packed bread rate was noted.
attributes.recommendation:
·         Standard set dough dividing weights should be adhered to in order to ensure production of standard weight bread.

  • High packed bread overweight rate should be addressed.
attributes.effect:
·         Under and overweight bread presence suggests inconsistency in dough dividing and this is justified by dough high overweight rate.

·         Presence of underweight bread exposes the company to risks of fines and penalties from regulatory bodies.

  • Overweight bread presence lowers yield targets hence withholding revenue targets.

value: • We will sensitize dough dividers adhere to set standard dough dividing weights and do frequent spot checks to ensure that set dough weights are observed in order to ensure production of standard weight bread.
• We will put more efforts and address overweight bread noted and also ensure production of standard weight bread.
• Bread weights sampled on 25.04.2025 showed high underweight bread rate.
Previous
• Sample varieties of packed bread were randomly picked and weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.
+ High overweight bread noted and this means non-compliance to production of standard bread weights.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring production of standard weight bread.

attributes.title: Bread damages analysis
attributes.description:
PRODUCTION DAMAGE ANALYSIS:

·          Production damage rate is tabulated below.

MARKET DAMAGE ANALYSIS:

·          Market damage rate is tabulated below.
attributes.recommendation:
·          Proper baking processes will ensure that damages are fully checked.

·          The management should focus on efforts to address high production damages to ensure that the company doesn’t lose revenues.
attributes.effect: + Slightly high bread damages implies that the company is exposed to losses and revenue targets were not realized.

value: • Production damage rate was almost within the set range. We will however ensure that damage rate is managed within the tolerable rate.
·          Noted slightly high production damages will be addressed.
• Analysis of bread damages showed high production and market damage rate as analyzed from 01/04/2025 – 19/04/2025.
Previous

·          The test was conducted to determine the extent of damages produced during production and those replaced as market damages and find out if they were within expected/set limits. High damages suggest bread of inferior quality produced.

·          Production damage rate allowed is 0.2% of total production while market damage allowed is 0.5% of net sales.
+ Production damages were almost within the allowed range while market damages were within the allowed range.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring bread damages are managed within the tolerable rate.

value: • Production damage rate was almost within the set range. We will however ensure that damage rate is managed within the tolerable rate.

Production damage rate allowed is 0.2% of total production while market damage allowed is 0.5% of net sales.

attributes.title: Mixing charts/summaries analysis
attributes.description:
Below are the summary of the findings

·          The above table shows that;

·          There was no significant variance between system and the actual material consumption.

·          Correct posting was also noted over the audited period.
attributes.recommendation: + The branch should continue observing the set consumption and production standards and ensuring that data is accurately transferred from production records to SAP system..
attributes.effect:
+ Consumption and production set standards were observed and this implies proper accountability of raw materials and finished goods.

+ Mixing chart data was accurate, and this ensures accountability of items issued and resulting products yields.

value: ·           This is noted and will be maintained.
• We will always ensure that actual production is reflected on production records/registers,
• April 2025 audit report highlighted that data was accurately transferred from mixing charts to summaries and correctly posted on SAP system as analyzed from 01.04.25 – 24.04.2025.
Previous
• Comparison of manual mixing charts and the system mixing charts was done from 01.05.25 – 22.05.25 to find out if accurate transfer of production data was being done.

+ Transfer of data from mixing charts to summaries and to SAP system was accurate.

+ Mixing chart data was also accurate.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring that mixing chart has accurate data which is subsequently transferred to the SAP system.

attributes.title: Physical cash verification
attributes.description:
·           Physical cash was verified on 24/05/2025, and below is a tabular analysis of the same.

Minimal variances were noted during spot-check.
attributes.recommendation: ·          Observed cash control is commendable.

value: • Proper cash control will be maintained.
• This trend will be maintained.

·          Physical cash verification on 01.05.2025 showed minimal variation between cashflow balance and physical cash counted.

  • Pending IUOs worth Kshs.3,000.00 were also noted.
Previous
·           A spot check was done on cash office to verify if the company petty cash was well maintained.
+ Cash was well controlled hence compliant with set cash handling SOPs.
Finance Department
+ Ensuring that cash is properly managed to avoid cash loss.

attributes.title: Mini shop spot check analysis.
attributes.description:
·          Mini shop spot check was conducted on 23.05.2025.

·         The shop attendant accounted for all the bread loaded.

·         All sales were made through Mpesa till.

·         The below table shows details of mini shop transactions.
attributes.recommendation: The Mini shop attendant should keep up with the observed good stock and cash control.
attributes.effect: Mini shop SOPs are followed.

value: Accountability and controls noted at the mini shop will always be ensured.
Controls on mini shop to be maintained.
Mini shop spot check on 25.04.25 showed proper controls and bread accountability.
Previous
·          A spot check was conducted in the mini shop to assess whether their operations were being carried out in accordance with the established standards.
+ Mini shop SOPs were observed.
Sales Department
+ Ensuring all bread and crates at the mini shop are accounted for.

attributes.title: Bread yield analysis
attributes.description:
·          From 3,772bags, total yield expected was 721,000.75pcs (upon conversion to 400g) and 721,000.75pcs was reflected on production records. Thus expected yields realized.

·          Breakdown of yields for the various bread varieties is tabulated below;
attributes.recommendation: ·         Noted realization of yield targets is commendable.
attributes.effect: + Revenue targets were realized.

value: + We always cross check production records to ensure that desired yields are accurately recorded.
+ We will keep on ensuring that expected yields are realized.
April 2025 audit report highlighted that desired yields were realized as analyzed from 01/04/2025 – 24/04/2025.
Previous

·          The exercise was conducted to determine if resulting yields for each variety matched expected yields (as per set BOMs) and also establish the consistency. Low yields than expected would be translated as concealing of actual yields denying the company revenues.
+ Expected yields were realized hence compliance to set yield policy.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring production of set bread yield standards.

attributes.title: Debtors analysis.
attributes.description: ·         Outstanding debts for route customers was Kshs.417,010.50 while for institutions was Kshs.248, 673.00.
attributes.recommendation: Sales team must ensure credit limits for institutions are set and follow up.
attributes.effect: High outstanding customer (route and institutions) balances without equal security deposit poses a great risk to the company of bad debts.

value:
·         Customer’s debts are recovered from their respective extra cents deposits.

Outstanding debts for institutions is managed from the head office.
·         Most of these balances are with customers with security deposits equal or more compared to the debt.
Debtor analysis dated 01.03.2025 showed outstanding balances totaling to Kshs. 234,926.00 for institutions and Kshs. 228,160.00 for route customers.
Previous
·         Analysis of the branch outstanding balances as at 25th May 2025 for routes and institutions was done to determine the debtors’ value and if the company is exposed to bad debts.
+ Outstanding balances means noncompliance to debt control policy.
Finance Department
+ Ensuring no customer has oustanding balances.

attributes.title: Production efficiency analysis
attributes.description:
PRODUCTION EFFICIENCY ANALYSIS:

·          Analysis was done from 01/05/2025 - 22/05/2025. Production efficiency is tabulated below;
attributes.recommendation:
·          The branch management should ensure proper production planning to address operational 1nefficiencies.

·          Surplus costs incurred from operational inefficiencies should be reversed and surcharged.
attributes.effect: Noted production  inefficiency increased production costs.

value: ·          Frequent shift cuts led to production inefficiency.
·          Production efficiency was affected by shifts.
April 2025 audit report highlighted packing inefficiency as analyzed from 01/04/2025 – 24/04/2025.
Previous

·          This test was conducted to determine if set production a efficiency was adhered to. Low efficiency would indicate increased production costs.

·          Standard production efficiency is 4.5bags/staff.
+ The branch showed noncompliance to set standard production efficiency.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensurirng that production efficiency set is realized.

attributes.title: Packing efficiency analysis.
attributes.description:
PACKING EFFICIENCY ANALYSIS:

·          Packing efficiency (01/05/2025 – 22/05/25) is tabulated below;
attributes.recommendation:
·          The branch management should ensure proper production planning to address operational 1nefficiencies.

·          Surplus costs incurred from operational inefficiencies should be reversed and surcharged.
attributes.effect: Noted packing inefficiency increased production costs.

value: ·          Packing efficiency was affected by crate shortage resulting from issuing Mibisco with 200-300crates almost daily, and evening deliveries which delay return of crates. Additionally, Moiben route was added from Rupa branch with no crates.
Packing efficiency was mainly affected by crates shortage and we have requested for more crates and this will address noted packing efficiency.
April 2025 audit report highlighted packing inefficiency as analyzed from 01/04/2025 – 24/04/2025.
Previous

·          This test was conducted to determine if set  packing efficiency was adhered to. Low efficiency would indicate increased production costs.

·          Packing efficiency was set at 1455pcs/person/8hr shift.
+ Packing inefficiency noted means noncompliance to set packing efficiency standards.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring that set packing efficiency standard is attained.

attributes.title: Motor vehicle mileage and fuel consumption analysis
attributes.description:
Analysis for motor vehicle fuel consumption was carried out from 01/05/2025 – 24/05/2025 and results were analyzed on the below table

MOTOR VEHICLE FUEL CONSUMPTION (01.05.25 – 24/05.2025)
attributes.recommendation: ·          Noted economical fuel consumption for most sales vans is commendable.
attributes.effect: Economical fuel consumption by sales vans checked operation costs.

value: ·          Daily monitoring of vans is always ensured to observe fuel consumption set policies.
·          We will maintain the observed trend of sales vans economical fuel consumption.
·          April 2025 audit report showed economical fuel consumption for motor vehicles for the month of April 2025 (01.04.25-25.04.2025).
Previous

The exercise was carried out to determine if fuel consumption quantities by sales vans  was at par with those provided on the revised permanent file. High fuel consumption would read increased operation costs.
+ Fuel consumption by motor vehicles complied with set fuel consumption standards.
Transport/Fleet Department
+ Ensuring fuel consumption by vehicles is as per set consumption standards.

attributes.title: Generator fuel consumption analysis
attributes.description:
·           Generator fuel consumption from 01/05/2025 – 24/05/2025.

·           Below is a tabular illustration of generator consumption.

GENERATOR : (01/05/25 - 24/05/25)
attributes.recommendation: + Standard fuel consumption for the generator should be provided. This will make it easier to monitor its fuel consumption.
attributes.effect: + Lack of set standard fuel consumption rate for the generator imply that fuel consumption cannot be monitored to control fuel wastage.

value: + We drain all purchased fuel as per instructed.
+ We will consult the concerned parties to be provided with fuel consumption rate for the generator.
+ Generator standard fuel consumption rate was not provided as per April 2025 audit report.
Previous

·            The exercise was carried out to determine if fuel consumption quantities by  generators was at par with those provided on the revised permanent file. High fuel consumption would read increased operation costs.
+ Standard fuel consumption rate for the generator was not provided. This makes it hard to track or monitor fuel consumption by the machine.
Ensuring generator fuel consumption is as per set standard consumption rate.
